item.title: The AI-Powered PDF Marks the End of an Era
item.description: As Adobe rolls out more generative AI features for the PDF, the era of chatbot-less software is firmly a thing of the past.

item.title: The AI-Powered PDF Marks the End of an Era
item.description: As Adobe rolls out more generative AI features for the PDF, the era of chatbot-less software is firmly a thing of the past.

item.title: Decoding Palantir, the Most Mysterious Company in Silicon Valley
item.description: This week on Uncanny Valley, we talk about one of the most notorious American corporations. So what does Palantir actually do?

item.title: Decoding Palantir, the Most Mysterious Company in Silicon Valley
item.description: This week on Uncanny Valley, we talk about one of the most notorious American corporations. So what does Palantir actually do?

item.title: Developers Say GPT-5 Is a Mixed Bag
item.description: Software engineers are finding OpenAI’s new GPT-5 model is helping them think through coding problems—but isn’t much better at actual coding.

item.title: Developers Say GPT-5 Is a Mixed Bag
item.description: Software engineers are finding OpenAI’s new GPT-5 model is helping them think through coding problems—but isn’t much better at actual coding.

item.title: What Does Palantir Actually Do?
item.description: Palantir is often called a data broker, a data miner, or a giant database of personal information. In reality, it’s none of these—but even former employees struggle to explain it.

item.description: Palantir is often called a data broker, a data miner, or a giant database of personal information. In reality, it’s none of these—but even former employees struggle to explain it.

item.title: How To Use Parallels to Run Windows on a Mac
item.description: This app gives you the full desktop PC experience on an Apple computer.

item.title: Murena’s Pixel Tablet is helping to wean me off Google
item.description: More gadgets should push privacy as a competitive feature.

item.title: How Apple’s New Spotlight Compares to Raycast
item.description: The new Spotlight launcher tool coming to macOS this year looks and works a lot like the indie application Raycast. Here’s what they can both do, and how they differ.

item.title: ChatGPT’s Study Mode Is Here. It Won’t Fix Education’s AI Problems
item.description: OpenAI’s new study mode for ChatGPT throws questions back at students, but the learning feature doesn’t address generative AI’s underlying disruption of education.

item.title: ChatGPT’s Study Mode Is Here. It Won’t Fix Education’s AI Problems
item.description: OpenAI’s new study mode for ChatGPT throws questions back at students, but the learning feature doesn’t address generative AI’s underlying disruption of education.

item.title: Blender developers begin work on full-fledged mobile version
item.description: Support will come to the iPad Pro first, with other platforms to follow.

item.title: Programmers Aren’t So Humble Anymore—Maybe Because Nobody Codes in Perl
item.description: Perl is a messy, maddening programming language, the “duct tape of the internet.” But at least you can tell it was made by humans.

item.title: Cursor’s New Bugbot Is Designed to Save Vibe Coders From Themselves
item.description: One of the most popular platforms for AI-assisted programming says the next era of vibe coding is all about supercharging error detection.

item.title: Former Top Google Researchers Have Made A New Kind of AI Agent
item.description: The mission? Teaching models to better understand how to build code will lead to superintelligent AI.

item.title: Get the macOS Finder to Do Just About Anything by Typing Natural Language Commands
item.description: With the app Substage, users can type out file management tasks in plain English, then use the commands it generates to convert file types, manage folders, create zip files, and more.

item.title: Get the macOS Finder to Do Just About Anything by Typing Natural Language Commands
item.description: With the app Substage, users can type out file management tasks in plain English, then use the commands it generates to convert file types, manage folders, create zip files, and more.
